title: Tariffs to put 'America first': Is Trump spelling doom for US? Economics explained
content: President Donald Trump's "America First" tariff policy has led to record revenue collections, but economic data reveals Americans bear the brunt of the costs. Tariffs are increasingly passed on to consumers and businesses, raising prices and contradicting claims of foreign payment, if rules of economics are studies. This strategy creates a dilemma between political popularity and growing economic burdens on households.

title: WTC 2025-27: Australia top table after 2-0 Ashes lead; where is India?
content: Australia have taken a commanding 2-0 lead in the Ashes series as they defeated England by eight wickets in the Brisbane day-night Test on Sunday. Joe Root scored his first Test century in Australia, but Australia established a significant first-innings lead. England fought back but ultimately fell short. With this win, Australia remain at the top of the World Test Championship standings.

title: Watch: CCTV catches UP cops ‚Äòdumping body‚Äô to avoid work; outrage on social media
content: Shocking CCTV footage revealed police officers dumping an unidentified body outside a shop in Meerut's Lohiyanagar area overnight. The incident sparked public outrage, leading to the suspension of an outpost in-charge, a constable, and termination of a home guard. An internal inquiry has been launched to identify the deceased and investigate the alleged attempt by police to evade postmortem procedures.

title: A softer side of Musk: Ex-wife recalls Christmas with Tesla CEO; ‚ÄòHe vanished at night and...‚Äô
content: Elon Musk's ex-wife Talulah Riley shared how he expressed his love despite immense pressure running multiple companies.  Forgetting a Christmas gift, Musk braved the snow barefoot to retrieve flowers from frozen ground, demonstrating his deep affection.  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang also praised Musk's early adoption of AI technology, highlighting his unique vision.

title: 'Wedding called off': Smriti Mandhana breaks silence on her marriage with Palash Muchhal
content: Indian women‚Äôs team vice-captain Smriti Mandhana on Sunday addressed weeks of speculation surrounding her personal life, confirming that her wedding with music composer Palash Muchhal has been "called off". The star batter appealed to fans and the media to respect the privacy of both families.

title: Bill Gates' daughter gets $30M for AI app: Gates says won't invest; works helpdesk
content: Phoebe Gates' artificial intelligence shopping startup, Phia, has raised $30 million in new funding. This investment values the company at $180 million. Bill Gates, Phoebe's father, has supported the venture with his time and experience. Phia aims to make online shopping smarter and more sustainable. The app offers price comparisons, discounts, and secondhand options.

title: 'Australia not for weak men': Stokes admits ENG failed in pressure
content: England captain Ben Stokes admitted his team struggled to handle pressure in key moments during their second Test defeat to Australia, leading to a 2-0 series deficit. Despite dropped catches and a lack of required mindset, Stokes believes a 3-2 Ashes victory is still possible if the team addresses issues quickly.

title: 'Bowl fast when nothing‚Äôs happening': Smith-Archer showdown lights up Ashes - Watch
content: Australia secured an eight-wicket victory in the second Ashes Test, taking a 2-0 series lead. During Australia's chase, Steve Smith and Jofra Archer engaged in a verbal exchange after Archer bowled a series of aggressive deliveries. Smith responded with boundaries, including a six, to finish the match.

title: ‚ÄòMetaverse‚Äô budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly planning to significantly cut its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its virtual reality ambitions. This move follows substantial losses and a lack of consumer interest in its VR products. The company is now prioritizing its artificial intelligence initiatives.

title: 'Could have done much more': Rajnath praises armed forces' role in Op Sindoor
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh stated that India's armed forces showed restraint during Operation Sindoor but possess the capability for a stronger response if needed. He highlighted the operation's success, attributing it to excellent coordination between forces, administration, and border residents, underscoring the vital role of enhanced border connectivity in national security and economic growth.

title: Smriti Mandhana & Palash Muchhal's wedding cancelled: Full timeline of events
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has officially confirmed her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal is off, ending weeks of speculation. She requested privacy for both families, stating her focus is now on representing India.  Calling herself a ‚Äúvery private person,‚Äù she urged restraint and understanding from the public.

title: Brittany Mahomes hits back as fans question Patrick Mahomes‚Äô legacy this season
content: Patrick Mahomes faces scrutiny amid the Kansas City Chiefs' uncertain playoff outlook. NBA star Kevin Durant and Mahomes' wife, Brittany, have publicly defended the quarterback, dismissing claims of a "down year" and questioning his legacy. With playoff hopes on the line, Week 14 presents a crucial opportunity for Mahomes to silence critics and reaffirm his all-time status.

title: '27-year backlog': CM Rekha Gupta blames past govts for Delhi pollution
content: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta stated that tackling the city's pollution crisis will require 27 months, blaming previous governments for inaction. Her comments followed protests demanding urgent measures against an "air emergency.

title: Dragon vs Eagle: Can US survive 'China Shock 2.0'? India could soften blow
content: China's economic rise, dubbed the "China Shock," is entering a new phase with advanced technologies like EVs and semiconductors. This "China Shock 2.0" threatens global manufacturing jobs and economic leadership, driven by China's industrial policy and dominance across key supply chains. Nations face a critical challenge in coordinating a response to prevent irreversible Chinese dominance.

title: Dance floor turns deadly: 25 dead after cylinder blast, helpline numbers issued; what we know so far
content: A devastating fire at the Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Arpora, Goa, claimed at least 25 lives, including tourists and staff, and injured six. The blaze, possibly ignited by a cylinder blast, spread rapidly through the temporary structure. Authorities have arrested club managers, with owners facing arrest warrants, as investigations into safety norms commence.

title: 'Stay in India her personal decision': EAM on Hasina's extradition; future hinges on circumstances
content: In a recent statement, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted that Sheikh Hasina's visit to India is a personal decision shaped by last year's developments. He underscored India's unwavering support for Bangladesh, reiterating the importance of democratic values. Jaishankar also defended India's sovereignty in foreign relations, stressing that no nation has the authority to dictate its alliances with others.

title: 'Have decided to move on': Palash Muchhal calls off wedding with Smriti Mandhana
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal have officially confirmed their wedding has been called off after weeks of speculation. Both shared statements on Instagram, citing personal difficulties and a desire for privacy. Mandhana emphasised her focus remains on representing India in cricket.

title: Watch: Kangana Ranaut, Mahua Moitra and Supriya Sule dance together at wedding
content: BJP MP Kangana Ranaut, TMC MP Mahua Moitra, and NCP (SP) MP Supriya Sule were captured dancing together at industrialist Naveen Jindal's daughter's wedding. The trio performed a popular Bollywood song, with videos of their unexpected collaboration going viral on social media. Ranaut had previously shared behind-the-scenes photos of dance practice with her political counterparts.

title: 'Kitchen was dead end': Witnesses recall night of horror at jam-packed North Goa club
content: A devastating fire ripped through a North Goa nightclub, claiming at least 25 lives and injuring many more. The blaze, reportedly triggered by an explosion, occurred in an establishment operating without valid permissions. Fire safety norms were not followed, and access for emergency services was severely hampered, leading to a tragic loss of life.

title: A Sholay song, music, dance: Goa nightclub in full party mode, then deadly fire kills 25
content: A devastating fire at a popular Goa nightclub claimed at least 25 lives and injured six others late Saturday night. The blaze, which broke out during peak hours, trapped many victims, primarily staff, due to suffocation. Authorities cited non-compliance with fire safety norms and lack of valid permissions as contributing factors to the tragedy.

title: On Live TV! Kuldeep Yadav calls Rohit Sharma India captain ‚Äî Watch
content: Speaking after the win, Kuldeep referred to Rohit Sharma as the captain before quickly correcting himself to name KL Rahul, who led the side in the absence of Shubman Gill. Kuldeep was one of the architects of India‚Äôs dominant win, returning figures of 4-41. India won the thtee-match series 2-1.

title: People living near mines showing lung damage
content: Recent findings indicate that neighborhoods adjacent to Indian mining operations are experiencing significant lung health issues and exposure to heavy metals, reflecting the dangers faced by workers. Research highlights concerning levels of abnormal lung function and signs of fibrosis, even among children, underscoring the severe impact of dust pollution.

title: IND vs SA: 'Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma have retired... ': Ex-India batting coach opens up
content: Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar asserts that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma deserve special treatment and their places in the ODI setup should never have been questioned. He believes their years of contribution and recent strong performances warrant a different evaluation standard, highlighting their impact on team morale and performance.

title: IndiGo turmoil: Centre slams Rahul Gandhi's 'monopoly model' remark
content: Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu countered Rahul Gandhi's criticism of the IndiGo crisis, asserting the government champions aviation competition to welcome new airlines and expand fleets. He highlighted recent legislation to reduce aircraft leasing costs, emphasizing the issue's public, not political, nature. Gandhi had blamed the government's 'monopoly model' for passenger woes.

title: Delhi boy sexually assaulted at govt school bathroom; act recorded and circulated among peers
content: An 11-year-old boy was allegedly sexually assaulted by four students, aged 12-15, inside a government school bathroom in Delhi's Rohini. The accused reportedly recorded a video of the assault and threatened the victim. Police apprehended the suspects, who have been sent to an Observation Home.

title: 'I've said it many times... ': Gambhir's big comment on Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli - Watch
content: Providing weight to the senior contingent, Virat Kohli emerged Player of the Series in the ODIs against South Africa, scoring two centuries and a fifty ‚Äî a swift return to the highs he consistently reached from 2015 onwards. Rohit Sharma added a couple of fifties, underlining his enduring touch and class.

title: Nitish Kumar enters World Book of Records - here is why
content: Bihar's Chief Minister, Nitish Kumar, has received a prestigious accolade from the World Book of Records, London, acknowledging his exemplary political service and dedication to democracy. This achievement marks his historic tenth oath-taking as Chief Minister, a milestone that underscores both his resilience in governance and the confidence bestowed upon him by the citizens of Bihar.

title: Watch: December blizzard in China goes viral for snow-globe streets and whirling powder
content: China's first snowfall brought a magical winter scene, while a new 'snow vacation' policy offers students in northeastern and northwestern regions a break to boost winter tourism. This initiative includes free access to scenic spots and ski venues for students, encouraging families to travel and enjoy the season.

title: Warner Bros-Netflix deal: Is the Tudum effect harmful for Indian cinema?
content: India's Multiplex Association warns that Netflix's acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery could harm the country's theatrical ecosystem. The shift threatens the supply of films crucial for cinema footfall, as Netflix prioritizes streaming over theatrical releases. While immediate impact may be limited, the merger raises concerns about content availability and theatrical windows.

title: 'Batting order is very overrated': Gautam Gambhir hints at chop-and-change policy
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir defended his flexible batting order approach in white-ball cricket, calling it "overrated" except for openers. He highlighted Washington Sundar's adaptability and team-first attitude. Gambhir also acknowledged dew's significant impact on the ODI series but expects less influence in the upcoming T20Is.

title: Air India crash: Investigators to meet in US next week, Boeing & others to join
content: India is sending accident investigators to Washington to review data and present their analysis on the June Air India crash. The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau will join the NTSB and Boeing representatives in a review meeting. This follows reports of tension between Indian and US authorities over the investigation's conduct.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Four tourists among 25 killed; were trapped along with staff in kitchen
content: A devastating fire at a North Goa nightclub has claimed 25 lives, including four tourists and 14 staff members. Six others were injured and are receiving medical attention. Initial investigations suggest the venue may have violated fire safety regulations. Authorities are conducting a thorough inquiry to determine the exact cause and ensure strict legal action against those responsible for this tragic incident.

title: Watch: Newly built NH 66 embankment collapses in Kerala; school bus, other vehicles trapped
content: A newly built National Highway 66 section in Kollam collapsed Friday, trapping vehicles including a school bus. Authorities are investigating the embankment failure, with initial suspicions pointing to the site's paddy field nature. This incident echoes a similar 2025 Malappuram collapse, prompting calls for stricter quality control and safety measures in ongoing highway projects.

title: 'Mota ho jaunga wapis': Rohit Sharma refuses to eat cake after India win - Watch
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's maiden ODI century (116*) powered India to a commanding nine-wicket victory over South Africa, clinching the series 2-1. Rohit Sharma also shone with 75 runs, crossing 20,000 international runs. The duo's 155-run opening stand set the stage for a dominant chase, with Virat Kohli adding an unbeaten 65.

title: New York house fire: Hyderabad cyber security professional dies in US
content: A devastating fire in Albany, USA, claimed the life of 24-year-old cybersecurity professional Sahaja Reddy Udumala from Hyderabad. The blaze engulfed a residential building, trapping Sahaja who had just returned from a night shift. Firefighters bravely rescued her and another severely injured individual. Investigations into the cause are ongoing.

title: Indigo fiasco: Airline chaos abates but baggage nightmare persists for passengers
content: Hundreds of passengers faced a chaotic ordeal at Kempegowda International Airport as IndiGo flights were cancelled, leading to prolonged waits for abandoned and often damaged baggage. Passengers described a system collapse with no clear communication or assistance, causing significant stress and loss.

title: Top finish! '12 sixes, 302 runs' - Virat Kohli says 'I feel really free in my mind'
content: Virat Kohli is back in top form, scoring 376 runs in his last four ODIs with two centuries and feeling liberated. After a Player of the Series award, he expressed his best rhythm in years, contributing to India's series win. Kohli, who holds the world record with 53 ODI centuries, rated his 135 in Ranchi as his best knock of the series.

title: Another Coup In Africa, Soldiers Appear On State TV To Announce Takeover
content: Military personnel in Benin on Sunday announced that they had ousted President Patrice Talon, although his entourage said he was safe and the army was regaining control.

title: "Step By Step, We're Getting Back": IndiGo CEO's Latest Message To Staff
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers on Sunday said the airline will be operating around 1,650 flights on Sunday and "step by step, we are getting back".

title: Delhi Airport Video Shows Luggage Remains A Challenge As IndiGo Crisis Eases
content: The flight crisis appears to ease after nearly a week, with IndiGo operationalising routes between 137 out of 138 destinations, but luggage remains a big challenge for the ground staff.

title: "Both Vomited Before Death": Body Of UP Man, Mother Found In Locked House, Say Cops
content: A 55-year-old man and his 75-year-old mother were found dead on separate cots inside their house in Bara Haveli Khalsa village here on Sunday, police said.

title: Watch: 6 Wild Elephants Stray Onto Haridwar Highway, Chaos Follows
content: Incidents of wild elephants straying into human settlements are on the rise in Uttarakhand's Haridwar district, raising concerns over growing human-wildlife conflict in the region.

title: IndiGo's Schedules Returning To Normal Levels, On-Time Performance Rises
content: IndiGo is on track to operate over 1,650 flights, up from 1,500 yesterday, the airline said in a status update this evening. It said 137 out of 138 destinations are in operation with on-time performance of 75 per cent, up from 30 per cent yesterday.

title: "Projection, Not Always Prognostication": S Jaishankar On AI's Role In Diplomacy
content: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar, on Saturday,offered a candid reflection on the growing influence of artificial intelligence in global diplomacy during a conversation with NDTV's CEO and Editor-in-Chief Rahul Kanwal at the HT Leadership Summit.

title: Former IAS Officer Convicted In Money-Laundering Case, Gets 5 Years In Jail
content: Former IAS officer and ex-District Collector of Bhuj, Pradeep Nirankarnath Sharma, has been convicted in two Prevention of Money Laundering Act cases. The judgment was delivered by a special court in Ahmedabad yesterday.

title: Telangana MLA Alleges Procedural Lapses In Assembly, Writes To Speaker
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi MLA T Harish Rao has written to the Telangana assembly Speaker Gaddam Prasad Kumar, alleging "several serious procedural lapses" that he claims have fundamentally undermined the legislature's constitutional mandate.

title: "We Could Have Done Much More Had We Wanted": Rajnath Singh On Op Sindoor
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday said the armed forces "could have done much more" during Operation Sindoor in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, but deliberately opted for a "restrained" and "calibrated" response.

title: Donald Trump To Shubhanshu Shukla: The Top 10 Newsmakers Of 2025
content: The year 2025 has been a whirlwind of big events and controversies, with personalities from several departments taking the centre stage.

title: Row Over Omar Abdullah's "Life Support" Jab: INDIA Divided, BJP Has A Laugh
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's strong remarks on the INDIA opposition bloc, in which he said the alliance is on "life support, have raised a political storm

title: Watch: Kangana Ranaut, Mahua Moitra, Supriya Sule Dance At Naveen Jindal's Daughter's Wedding
content: Forgetting political differences, BJP MP Kangana Ranaut, Trinamool Congress leader Mahua Moitra, and NCP's Supriya Sule took the stage atthe wedding festivities of Yashaswini Jindal, daughter of industrialist-politician Naveen Jindal

title: College Student Dies By Suicide At Noida Hostel, Cops Find "I Give Up" Note
content: The police found the body of Krishnakant, a resident of Jharkhand, in his hostel in Greater Noida on Saturday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What The IndiGo Crisis Reveals About The Fragility Of Indian Aviation
content: The indelible images of passengers sleeping rough on cold terminal floors, captured and broadcast across every channel, will outlast a thousand corporate advertising campaigns by IndiGo. The urgent push for reform can no longer be ignored.

title: 70,000 Ukrainian Women Join Army To Fight Russia War, 20% Rise Since 2022
content: Over 70,000 women are serving in Ukraine's armed forces in 2025, a 20 per cent increase since 2022, with more than 5,500 deployed directly to the front line.

title: Withdrawing Cash? New Rules Could Cost You 84% of Whatever is Lying at Home
content: For individuals and small businesses used to handling cash, the message is clear: document everything or risk financial ruin.

title: Video: Goa Club Grooves To 'Mehbooba Mehbooba', Flames Appear In Background
content: When the deadly fire in Goa's 'Birch By Romeo Lane' began last night, about 100 tourists were enjoying a much-publicised 'Bollywood Banger Night'

title: All About The "Hindu Rate Of Growth" And The Debate Around It
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday denounced attempts to link India's past economic slowdown with the Hindu faith, calling the "Hindu rate of growth" label a deliberate distortion.

title: Projecting the final CFP top 12: Where does Alabama land?
content: One last assessment of how the committee could stack the top teams in the country ahead of the final ranking.

title: Hoosiers bask in Big Ten title, CFP's No. 1 seed
content: Indiana capped off a memorable, magical Big Ten season by outlasting Ohio State 13-10 in the conference championship game to remain undefeated on the eve of the College Football Playoff's final rankings.

title: Duke stirs CFP pot, calls for bid as ACC champion
content: Duke won its first outright ACC title since 1962 and threw the College Football Playoff into chaos by defeating No. 17 Virginia 27-20 in overtime, likely sending James Madison into the playoff field.

title: Loss to IU won't 'sit well' as OSU turns to CFP
content: For the second time in as many years, Ohio State, the defending national champion. will enter the College Football Playoff coming off a 13-10 loss, this time to Indiana in the Big Ten title game Saturday night, the Buckeyes' first loss of the season.

title: Yan ends Dvalishvili's reign, reclaims title in thriller
content: Petr Yan got his revenge and recaptured the bantamweight title Saturday night, claiming a unanimous decision victory over Merab Dvalishvili in their rematch at UFC 323.

title: Kerr lauds 'competitor' Spencer after career night
content: Playing on the road without their headliners, the Warriors upset the Cavaliers 99-94 on Saturday night behind a career performance from two-way point guard Pat Spencer.

title: Pantoja injured in opening seconds; Van wins title
content: Alexandre Pantoja's flyweight title reign came to a shocking end Saturday night when he injured his left shoulder just 26 seconds in and lost his belt to Joshua Van via TKO.

title: DeBoer lobbies for Bama: Tide deserve CFP berth
content: Alabama coach Kalen DeBoer said Saturday's loss to Georgia in the SEC championship game shouldn't count against the Crimson Tide.

content: We're looking ahead to how the 14-team playoff picture could line up -- and who will win divisions -- en route to Super Bowl LX.

content: A season that started with doubts ends in triumph as Lionel Messi helps steer Inter Miami to their first MLS Cup title.

content: Mohamed Salah appears to have borrowed from Cristiano Ronaldo's playbook: airing frustrations toward his manager that stem from his own poor form.

content: Two Steelers legends have joined the chorus of voices calling for the franchise to move on from Mike Tomlin, with Ben Roethlisberger even suggesting that Tomlin is a good fit for the vacant Penn State job.

title: üèÄ Clippers abruptly sever ties with Chris Paul
content: Chris Paul, one of the greatest players in Clippers franchise history, posted an Instagram story a little before 3 a.m. ET Wednesday that he had just learned he was being sent home to Los Angeles from Atlanta.

content: From All-Star outfielders to elite aces, here are the big names your team could be targeting this winter.

content: The draw is complete for the 2026 World Cup! What are the top matches to watch, and how will it all go down? We asked ESPN's writers to break down each group, highlight the storylines and make their predictions.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man Utd target Mouzakitis chooses next club
content: Real Madrid and Manchester United target Christos Mouzakitis has made his choice if he leaves Olympiacos. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bihar to establish 100 Fast Track Courts for quicker disposal of pending criminal cases
content: Mr. Choudhary also informed that eight fast track courts are proposed in Patna, while four each will be established in Gaya, Muzaffarpur, Darbhanga, and Bhagalpur.

title: Chickballapur police to reinstate helmet rule after nine years
content: According to statistics, a total of 306  fatal cases reported this year so far where 333 people were killed and 900 people sustained injuries.

title: I am not with agitation, but with dialogue: Himanta on Tezpur University protests
content: The students of the central university have enforced a "complete shutdown" on the campus since November 29, forcing the administration to cancel all end-of-term examinations

title: BLOs will be beaten up if they attempt irregularities in voters' list: Tripura Congress MLA
content: Sudip Roy Barman said Congress wants a transparent and error-free electoral roll, and would not allow what "had happened in Maharashtra, Bihar and Haryana" in Tripura

title: Defence Minister dedicates 125 BRO projects to nation
content: These projects ‚Äî built at a cost of ‚Çπ5,000 crore and spread across the Union Territories of Ladakh and Jammu and Kashmir, and seven States including Arunachal Pradesh, Sikkim, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, West Bengal and Mizoram ‚Äî consisted of 28 roads, 93 bridges and four miscellaneous works

title: Five Thane civic staffers booked as key development proposal file goes missing
content: The issue of the missing file surfaced for the first time 18 months ago after a resident filed a Right to Information plea seeking certified copies of the documents linked to the proposal, the Naupada police station official said.

title: SEC to ask Kerala govt. to examine whether postal ballot facility can be expanded in future local body polls
content: At present, only election officials are eligible for postal ballots in the local body polls in Kerala

title: After spending 8 years in prison, man acquitted in POCSO case
content: The statement of the victim, who was said to be suffering from moderate intellectual disability, contradicted other evidence, said the special court for POCSO Act

title: 10 blackbucks die due to 'bacterial infection' in Zoological Park in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur
content: ‚ÄúIt is suspected to be H.S. (Haemorrhagic Septicaemia), which is a bacterial disease caused by Pasteurella species of bacteria. The disease is also known as Pasteurellosis,‚Äù Dr. Pragya Lakra said

title: Kerala among top States in services employment: NITI Aayog report
content: As per the study, 48.5% of Kerala‚Äôs workforce is engaged in services as of 2023-24. This is far above the national average of 29.7%

title: Nanjangud banana area sees revival as farmers get support, subsidy
content: Major push to save heritage GI-tagged Rasabale from decline; efforts are underway to revive the fading crop affected earlier by Panama wilt with scientists and horticulture officials working together to save the crop

title: Winter migratory birds visit Nilgiris in large numbers, buntings recorded for first time
content: The Grey-necked Bunting was observed in Kotagiri, while the Black-headed Bunting was sighted in Masinagudi

title: Watch: Goa governor visits injured nightclub fire victims at medical college
content: Goa Governor P Ashok Gajapathi Raju visited six victims of the nightclub fire who are undergoing treatment at the Goa Medical College and Hospital. Talking to reporters outside the GMCH, the Governor termed the fire incident as ‚Äúunfortunate‚Äù and said that the injured were receiving the best care.

title: Ten fishing boats gutted in massive fire in Kollam
content: Rescue operations severely hampered by explosion of onboard gas cylinders and poor road connectivity to the area.  Despite the challenges, local residents and Fire and Rescue Services manage to prevent a larger disaster by successfully moving eight other moored boats away from the flames

title: Environmental protection not merely technical mandate or administrative obligation, but a constitutional guarantee: SC Judge
content: A renewed commitment to ensure that environmental governance is driven by sustained institutional responsibility, not symbolism, Justice R. Mahadevan said

title: T.N. Rising Summit in Madurai sees 91 MoUs, Stalin says focus is on uniform development
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin said his government has taken several initiatives to bring the southern region on par with other regions in terms of industrial progress

title: Fee determination order to be produced for renewal of recognition of private schools in Tamil Nadu
content: The School Education Department has recently amended the Tamil Nadu Private Schools (Regulation) Rules, 2023 to include a fresh sub-rule in this regard

title: No ‚Äògood certificate‚Äô to Jamaat-e-Islami Hind ever, says Kerala CM
content: CM Pinarayi Vijayan labels Jamaat-e-Islami Hind as ‚Äúanti-social‚Äù, denying any endorsement from CPI(M) or Left Democratic Front

title: ED to chargesheet Gurugram realty company, promoter for multi-crore 'fraud' in PMAY
content: The ED has alleged that the MD of a Gurugram-based real estate company ‚Äòfraudulently diverted‚Äô and laundered homebuyers' funds worth ‚Çπ222 crore collected under PMAY

content: Udhayanidhi Stalin said it was everyone‚Äôs duty to contribute for the welfare of the service personnel and their families

title: Govt denies issuing any advisory to stop clean energy funding
content: The New And Renewable Energy Minister‚Äôs letter rattled solar manufacturers in India, with many raising concerns that the move could choke funding for the entire sector

title: Head Constable accused of stealing cash suspended  after FIR filed against him
content: Zabeeullah, along with his colleague, had seized the car belonging to the suspect at Devanahalli on December 13 and was brought to the station for inquiry; He allegedly later stole the bag containing cash and other valuables

title: Court to deliver verdict in actor Dileep rape case on December 8
content: The case had attracted wide attention as a young woman actor was allegedly abducted and raped inside a moving car, and actor Dileep was arraigned as an accused in the case

title: IndiGo to operate 11 flights, cancel 10 from Vizag Airport on December 7
content: Passengers face significant disruptions as IndiGo cancels nearly half of its scheduled flights from Vizag, prompting calls for government intervention to ensure refunds and support for those affected

title: Parliamentary panel to summon airline executives, regulator over flight disruptions
content: A member says the panel has taken serious note of the difficulties faced by thousands of passengers due to disruption in air services, and air fares shooting up

title: Any kind of threat or intimidation to individual or party will not be tolerated: Tripura CM Manik Saha
content: Tripura CM Manik Saha said every individual and political party has the right to visit or join programmes anywhere in the State

title: IndiGo board‚Äôs crisis management group regularly monitoring situation: Airline
content: The board of Interglobe Aviation will take care of the challenges faced by IndiGo customers and ensure refunds to passengers

title: Procedural lapses dent Telangana Assembly credibility, says BRS MLA Harish Rao in open letter to Speaker
content: In the letter to Assembly Speaker Gaddam Prasad Kumar, the former minister also lamented the reduction of the working days of the House

title: WHO, B-school study shows how digitally unified insurance systems can transform India's healthcare
content: India‚Äôs shift towards unified Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PMJAY) offers a unique real-world laboratory for understanding the power of digital integration in healthcare

title: Cheetah cub dies after being hit by unidentified vehicle in Gwalior
content: The nearly 20-month-old cub had ventured out of KNP and got separated from its mother. It died after being hit by an unidentified vehicle

title: IndiGo to operate 1,650 flights on December 7, cancels 650
content: IndiGo also said it is expecting to stabilise the network by December 10 against the earlier anticipated timeline of December 10-15

title: Tamil Nadu Government frames rules for sale, exchange, lease and mortgage of temple lands
content: The Alienation of Immovable Property of the Religious Institutions Rules, 2025 lay down elaborate guidelines

title: Land acquisition delays hamper execution of railway projects in Tamil Nadu: Union Minister Vaishnaw
content: Ashwini Vaishnaw, in Parliament, said that the Centre is geared up to execute projects. However, success depends upon the support of the Tamil Nadu Government

title: ‚ÄòWe were going to speak on Christmas‚Ä¶ now I‚Äôm left with regret‚Äô: childhood friends grieve Hyderabad student who died in U.S. fire
content: Sahaja Reddy Udumala, a Master‚Äôs student in New York, succumbed to severe burn injuries affecting nearly 90% of her body

title: PM Modi to initiate debate on Vande Mataram in Lok Sabha on December 8
content: The Government sought a debate on Vande Mataram, composed by Bankimchandra Chatterjee, after PM Modi accused Congress of removing key stanzas in 1937 and sowing the seeds of partition

title: Thousands of devotees from across Bengal, other States arrive in Kolkata for mega Gita recital
content: 'Panch Lakkho Konthe Gita Path' (Gita chanting by five lakh voices) is being projected as the largest collective recital of the Bhagavad Gita ever attempted in the State and possibly in the country

title: Kerala local body polls: Candidates make final pitch to voters as open campaigning for Phase 1 draws to a close on Dec. 7
content: In play in the first phase of polling on Tuesday (December 9) are three Municipal Corporations, 39 municipalities, seven district panchayats and 75 block panchayats

title: Act against paper leaks, illegal mining: Bihar Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary
content: Mr. Choudhary, who holds the Home portfolio, also directed officers to immediately seize and auction vehicles used in illegal mining

title: Protesters vow to keep Tezpur University shut until formal steps taken to remove V-C
content: Students, teachers, and staff at the Tezpur University have been protesting since mid-September against the Vice-Chancellor for alleged corruption and irregularities, demanding his removal and an inquiry

title: Goa nightclub fire: Magisterial probe ordered; FIR lodged against owner, GM
content: The popular party venue at Arpora village, located around 25 km from the state capital Panaji, opened last year

title: Faced criticism from my own community for advocating creamy layer principle: former CJI Gavai
content: The former CJI Gavai, who retired as CJI recently, was delivering a lecture on "Role of Affirmative Action in Promoting Equal Opportunity" at Mumbai University

title: College teacher on SIR duty in U.P.‚Äôs Ghaziabad dies
content: The 58-year-old teacher died of a brain haemorrhage, officials said; college principal said he was under ‚Äòheavy work pressure‚Äô

title: IndiGo flight disruptions: Hyderabad airport sees 115 cancellations on Dec. 7, taking five-day total over 500
content: Although IndiGo has maintained that cancellations will reduce gradually, passengers with imminent travel plans remain unsure whether their flights will operate

title: There‚Äôs something in the Mumbai air
content: Even as doctors speak out about rising air pollution levels in Maharashtra‚Äôs capital city and environmental activists cry hoarse about political and bureaucratic lethargy, Mumbai‚Äôs 2.2 crore residents report increasing ill-health and higher medical bills

title: Goa night club fire LIVE: 25 killed in massive blaze at nightclub; violation of safety norms suspected
content: President Droupadi Murmu, PM Modi and other leaders express deep grief over the fire mishap in Arpora

title: Neighbours in uniform: police in north of Hyderabad reach out to senior citizens living alone
content: Officers from the North Zone of Hyderabad police are visiting senior citizens living alone, checking on their safety, verifying domestic help and offering support against cyber fraud, while also linking them with local communities to reduce isolation and improve access to routine assistance.

title: What did Putin‚Äôs visit to India achieve? | Explained
content: Where do India-Russia relations stand? What did the two sides agree on during the recent summit? What statements did both leaders make on the Ukraine war? Why is Putin‚Äôs visit significant at this juncture when India is negotiating a free trade agreement with the U.S.?

title: 25 killed, 6 injured in fire at nightclub in North Goa
content: As per initial information, the nightclub had not abided by the fire safety norms, Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said

title: West Bengal SIR row: SC, ST activists urge ECI to simplify rules, set up assistance camps
content: In a letter to the CEC, the rights body appealed for marginalised people to be able to link themselves to any relative across their extended family whose name is present in the electoral roll of 2002, and urged the Commission to organise assistance camps

title: S. Muralidhar | Humane justice
content: The former Chief Justice of the Orissa High Court will head a UN Commission to investigate human rights violations in the occupied Palestinian territories

title: J&K L-G and CM spar over age relaxation for job aspirants amid protests
content: Hundreds of job aspirants who have crossed the age bar of 32 are unable to sit for the examination. The Open Merit aspirants are protesting to increase the current upper age limit from 32 to 37 to bring it at par with the rest of the country.

title: ‚ÄòHistoric blunders‚Äô on J&K and China are Nehru‚Äôs legacy: BJP
content: Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, those ‚Äúblunders‚Äù are being corrected, says BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

title: Field trips to city‚Äôs urban farms help schoolchildren to learn from nature
content: Size of these farms vary from 30 cents to a few acres, with crops such as paddy being grown on them; students are taught to do farm work and given farm fresh food, while introduced to a nature-centric lifestyle; some offer programmes and syllabuses focusing on practical aspects of farming

title: Former IAS officer gets five-year jail term in money laundering case
content: The court noted that the accused officer caused a loss to the government exchequer to the tune of ‚Çπ1.20 crore.

title: CPI(M) MP seeks JPC or judicial inquiry into ‚Äòexploitative airfare surge‚Äô
content: The crisis following the enforcement of revised Flight Duty Time Limitation (FDTL) norms has exposed deep structural failures in regulatory preparedness, market oversight, and consumer protection, leaving ordinary passengers dangerously vulnerable, says MP John Brittas

title: Government women‚Äôs polytechnic building in Nellore cries for repairs
content: Despite appeals for renovation works, Department of Technical Education has not sought funds from the State government, citing budget constraints

title: Appoint Leaders of Opposition for Maharashtra Assembly: Uddhav
content: More than a year after the Assembly election, ‚Äòthe LoP must be appointed and we have been demanding this‚Äô the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said

title: 9 of 20 IndiGo flights cancelled in Visakhapatnam
content: While the IndiGo crisis has caused widespread disruption for flyers in major cities, the impact at Vijayawada has been limited

title: Congress top brass discusses Karnataka leadership issue, to meet again
content: Party president Mallikarjun Kharge, former party chief and Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi and the general secretary in-charge of organisation K.C. Venugopal attended the closed door meeting at Congress Parliamentary Party (CPP) chairperson Sonia Gandhi‚Äôs official residence

title: Congress cites Maniben Patel‚Äôs diary entries, asks Rajnath to apologise for Babri claim
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh claimed the Defence Minister was spreading falsehoods to ‚Äúimprove his relationship‚Äù with Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Local body polls too complex to be a referendum on LDF government in Kerala
content: An analysis of the previous three-tier local body elections reveals that regional issues and candidates outweigh State-level political dynamics, particularly in the grama panchayats and block panchayats. State politics, however, is reflected in the district panchayat divisions, municipalities, and Corporations

title: Stalin virtually inaugurates village knowledge centres in Vellore, nearby districts
content: The centres consist of an administrative office, a skill training hall, a computer lab, a library, training rooms, an instructor‚Äôs office, and toilets. They also have public halls that can accommodate around 200 people

title: DGCA serves show-cause notice to IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers
content: The CEO has to respond to the show-cause notice within 24 hours on why ‚Äúappropriate enforcement action should not be initiated against you‚Äù, placing him under direct regulatory scrutiny

title: J.P. Nadda alleges Hemant Soren of betraying people of Jharkhand
content: Mr. Nadda also accuses the Soren government of siphoning off funds from the mining of natural resources¬†

title: Modi govt. sparing IndiGo as it bought poll bonds: Congress
content: It says BJP encashed most of the ‚Çπ56-cr. bonds purchased by IndiGo‚Äôs parent firm and founder; alleges govt. favoured corporate allies and killed competition in the once-vibrant airline industry

title: Education is the foundation for social progress, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: He inaugurates two social justice hostels for women college students, additional buildings for 21 schools, and 25 village knowledge centres built at a total cost of ‚Çπ74.2 crore in various places in the State

title: India will help build ‚Äòinclusive‚Äô Bangladesh: High Commissioner
content: Pranay Verma India‚Äôs High Commissioner to Bangladesh, spoke in Dhaka on Maitri Divas, ‚Äòa day for remembrance and gratitude‚Äô commemorating India‚Äôs recognition of Bangladesh as an independent nation

title: 150 years of Vande Mataram: Why BJP and Congress are fighting over its ‚Äòmissing stanzas‚Äô ‚Äî explained
content: parliament will begin a special discussion in the Lok Sabha on Monday to commemorate 150 years of Vande Mataram . the song remains one of the most debated symbols of India‚Äôs freedom struggle . prime minister Narendra Modi will open the debate, with defence minister Rajnath Singh scheduled to conclude it .

title: ‚¨Ü‚¨á 2026 college football recruiting class rankings
content: USC has put itself in position to snap the five-cycle streak of SEC teams finishing with the No. 1-ranked class . some programs, including the no. 1 overall player, Lamar Brown, remain unsigned . there are still questions to be answered and opportunities to make a move in the 2026 class rankings .

title: Key intel on the games that could decide three division races
content: no division winners will be crowned this week in the NFL . three games Sunday could go a long way toward deciding who wins the NFC North and a pair of divisions in the AFC . the three first-place showdowns are the Chicago Bears (9-3-1) at Green Bay Packers (8-3) at Jacksonville Jaguars (8-4) in the aFC South and Pittsburgh Steelers (6-6) in the Baltimore Ravens .

title: How much time will Amorim get to build his Man United team?
content: Ruben Amorim is leading a long-term project but at a club which demands short-term success . the portuguese coach says there is no time in the club . amorim says he has a lot of problems at old trafford . click here for all the latest transfer news .

title: Hicks, ex-owner of Rangers and Stars, dies at 79
content: philanthropist Tom Hicks dies peacefully in Dallas surrounded by family . he owned two Dallas-area professional sports franchises and an English Premier League soccer team . the businessman was 79 .

title: Champ Week: A new No. 1, is Bama out and ACC chaos
content: the college football playoff field will impact their final ranking on selection day . the committee is gathered at its headquarters in the Gaylord Texan Resort in Grapevine, Texas, to watch conference championship games . we're tracking all the conference title games and the impact on the field .

title: Yan's and Van's wins at UFC 323 throw kinks into the MMA timeline
content: the final UFC pay-per-view of 2025 delivered two new champions . Petr Yan and Joshua Van unseated Merab Dvalishvili and Alexandre Pantoja . a new hard-to-watch moment that resulted in an injury may end up affecting that weight class .
